Pre-Game Insights: South Korea head to China on the back of four straight wins with four goals or more and five straight clean sheets.
China also picked up a win on Thursday, earning a 2-1 victory away to Thailand.
South Korea's strategy includes focusing on crosses and aerial duels, while China will look to attack Korea, potentially creating space in the middle.
Korea's midfielders, such as Hwang In-beom, are expected to play key roles in build-up play.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Lee Kang-in is highlighted as a pivotal player for South Korea, scoring one and assisting one goal in the win against Singapore.
Wu Lei, China's forward, scored his 33rd goal for the national team in the 2-1 win over Thailand.
Head-to-head statistics show South Korea has won the last three meetings against China.
